com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.controller

Class EntityNetworkController<T extends CommonEntity<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.entity.CommonEntityController<T>
      • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.controller.EntityNetworkController<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - - type of Common Entity this controller is for
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Tickable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultEntityNetworkController, ExternalEntityNetworkController

    public abstract class EntityNetworkController<T extends CommonEntity<?>>
extends CommonEntityController<T>
    A controller that deals with the server to client network synchronization.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ABSOLUTE_UPDATE_INTERVAL
      The tick interval at which the entity is updated absolutely
      FloatAbstract headRotLive
      Obtains the protocol head rotation as it is live, on the server.
      FloatAbstract headRotSynched
      Obtains the protocol head rotation as the clients know it, allowing it to be read from or written to
      LocationAbstract locLive
      Obtains the protocol location as it is live, on the server.
      LocationAbstract locSynched
      Obtains the protocol location as the clients know it, allowing it to be read from or written to
      static double MAX_RELATIVE_DISTANCE
      The maximum allowed distance per relative movement update
      static double MIN_RELATIVE_POS_CHANGE
      The minimum value position change that is able to trigger an update
      static float MIN_RELATIVE_ROT_CHANGE
      The minimum value rotation change that is able to trigger an update
      static double MIN_RELATIVE_VELOCITY
      The minimum velocity change that is able to trigger an update
      IntegerAbstract ticks
      Obtains the tick time, this is for how long this network component/entry has been running on the server.
      VectorAbstract velLive
      Obtains the live protocol velocity, allowing it to be read from or written to
      VectorAbstract velSynched
      Obtains the velocity as the clients know it, allowing it to be read from or written to

      • velSynched

        public VectorAbstract velSynched
        Obtains the velocity as the clients know it, allowing it to be read from or written to

      • velLive

        public VectorAbstract velLive
        Obtains the live protocol velocity, allowing it to be read from or written to

      • locSynched

        public LocationAbstract locSynched
        Obtains the protocol location as the clients know it, allowing it to be read from or written to

      • locLive

        public LocationAbstract locLive
        Obtains the protocol location as it is live, on the server. Read is mainly supported, writing to it is not recommended. Although it has valid setters, the loss of accuracy of the protocol values make it rather pointless to use.

      • headRotSynched

        public FloatAbstract headRotSynched
        Obtains the protocol head rotation as the clients know it, allowing it to be read from or written to

      • headRotLive

        public FloatAbstract headRotLive
        Obtains the protocol head rotation as it is live, on the server. Only reading is supported.

      • ticks

        public IntegerAbstract ticks
        Obtains the tick time, this is for how long this network component/entry has been running on the server. The tick time can be used to perform operations on an interval. The tick time is automatically updated behind the hood.

      • getTicksSinceLocationSync

        public int getTicksSinceLocationSync()
        Gets the amount of ticks that have passed since the last Location synchronization. A location synchronization means that an absolute position update is performed.
        Returns:
        ticks since last location synchronization

      • isUpdateTick

        public boolean isUpdateTick()
        Checks whether the current update interval is reached
        Returns:
        True if the update interval was reached, False if not

      • bind

        public final void bind(T entity,
                       java.lang.Object entityTrackerEntry)
        Binds this Entity Network Controller to an Entity. This is called from elsewhere, and should be ignored entirely.
        Parameters:
        entity - to bind with
        entityTrackerEntry - to bind with

        Returns:

      • addViewer

        public boolean addViewer(org.bukkit.entity.Player viewer)
        Adds a new viewer to this Network Controller. Calling this method also results in spawn messages being sent to the viewer. When overriding, make sure to always check the super-result before continuing!
        Parameters:
        viewer - to add
        Returns:
        True if the viewer was added, False if the viewer was already added

      • removeViewer

        public boolean removeViewer(org.bukkit.entity.Player viewer)
        Removes a viewer from this Network Controller. Calling this method also results in destroy messages being sent to the viewer. When overriding, make sure to always check the super-result before continuing!
        Parameters:
        viewer - to remove
        Returns:
        True if the viewer was removed, False if the viewer wasn't contained

      • updateViewer

        public final void updateViewer(org.bukkit.entity.Player viewer)
        Adds or removes a viewer based on viewer distance
        Parameters:
        viewer - to update

      • setRemoveNextTick

        public void setRemoveNextTick(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                              boolean remove)
        Sets whether this Entity is marked for removal during the next tick for the player
        Parameters:
        player - to set it for
        remove - - True to remove, False NOT to remove

      • makeHidden

        public void makeHidden(org.bukkit.entity.Player viewer,
                       boolean instant)
        Ensures that the Entity is no longer displayed to the viewer
        Parameters:
        viewer - to hide this Entity for
        instant - option: True to instantly hide, False to queue it for the next tick

      • makeHidden

        public void makeHidden(org.bukkit.entity.Player viewer)
        Ensures that the Entity is no longer displayed to the viewer. The entity is not instantly hidden; it is queued for the next tick.
        Parameters:
        viewer - to hide this Entity for

      • makeHiddenForAll

        public void makeHiddenForAll(boolean instant)
        Ensures that the Entity is no longer displayed to any viewers. All viewers will see the Entity disappear.
        Parameters:
        instant - option: True to instantly hide, False to queue it for the next tick

      • makeHiddenForAll

        public void makeHiddenForAll()
        Ensures that the Entity is no longer displayed to any viewers. All viewers will see the Entity disappear. This method queues for the next tick.

      • makeVisible

        public void makeVisible(org.bukkit.entity.Player viewer)
        Ensures that the Entity is displayed to the viewer. Can be overridden to completely alter how the entity is spawned.
        Parameters:
        viewer - to display this Entity for

      • initMetaData

        public void initMetaData(org.bukkit.entity.Player viewer)
        Synchronizes all Entity Meta Data including Entity Attributes and other specific flags. Movement and positioning information is not updated.

        This should be called when making this Entity visible to a viewer.

        Parameters:
        viewer - to send the meta data to

      • syncRespawn

        public void syncRespawn()
        Synchronizes everything by first destroying and then respawning this Entity to all viewers

      • onTick

        public void onTick()
        Description copied from interface: Tickable
        Updates the object state as part of a single tick (1/20th second)
        Specified by:

        Overrides:

      • onSync

        @Deprecated
public void onSync()
        Deprecated. 
        Called at a set interval to synchronize data to clients. Deprecated: please use onTick() instead.

      • getSynchedPassengers

        public java.util.List<org.bukkit.entity.Entity> getSynchedPassengers()
        Gets a list of passengers that have last been synchronized to the viewers. On MC 1.8.8 this will return the last known passenger entity.
        Returns:
        list of last known passengers

      • isPassengersChanged

        public boolean isPassengersChanged()
        Checks whether there are any passenger changes pending.

        Checks whether passengers have changed since the last sync. On MC 1.8.8, this method checks whether the vehicle of this Entity has changed instead.
        Returns:
        True if changed, False if not

      • isPositionChanged

        public boolean isPositionChanged(double minChange)
        Checks whether one of the position (protocol) component differences between live and synched exceed the minimum change provided. In short, it checks whether the position changed.
        Parameters:
        minChange - to look for
        Returns:
        True if changed, False if not

      • isRotationChanged

        public boolean isRotationChanged(float minChange)
        Checks whether one of the rotation (protocol) component differences between live and synched exceed the minimum change provided. In short, it checks whether the rotation changed.
        Parameters:
        minChange - to look for
        Returns:
        True if changed, False if not

      • isVelocityChanged

        public boolean isVelocityChanged(double minChange)
        Checks whether the velocity difference between live and synched exceeds the minimum change provided. In short, it checks whether the velocity changed.
        Parameters:
        minChange - to look for
        Returns:
        True if changed, False if not

      • isHeadRotationChanged

        public boolean isHeadRotationChanged(float minChange)
        Checks whether the head rotation difference between live and synched exceeds the minimum change provided. In short, it checks whether the head rotation changed.
        Parameters:
        minChange - to look for
        Returns:
        True if changed, False if not

      • syncMetaData

        public void syncMetaData()
        Synchronizes all Entity Meta Data including Entity Attributes and other specific flags. Movement and positioning information is not updated. Only the changes are sent, it is a relative update.

      • syncPassengers

        public void syncPassengers()
        Synchronizes the entity Vehicle to all viewers. Updates when the vehicle changes.

      • syncHeadRotation

        public void syncHeadRotation()
        Synchronizes the entity head yaw rotation to all viewers.

      • syncHeadRotation

        public void syncHeadRotation(float headRotation)
        Synchronizes the entity head yaw rotation to all viewers.
        Parameters:
        headRotation - to set to

      • syncVelocity

        public void syncVelocity()
        Synchronizes the entity velocity to all viewers. Based on a change in Velocity, velocity will be updated.

      • syncVelocity

        public void syncVelocity(org.bukkit.util.Vector velocity)
        Synchronizes the entity velocity
        Parameters:
        velocity - (new)

      • syncVelocity

        public void syncVelocity(double velX,
                         double velY,
                         double velZ)
        Synchronizes the entity velocity
        Parameters:
        velX -
        velY -
        velZ -

      • syncLocation

        public void syncLocation()
        Synchronizes the entity location to all clients. Based on the distances, relative or absolute movement is performed.

      • syncLocationAbsolute

        public void syncLocationAbsolute()
        Synchronizes the entity position / rotation absolutely

      • syncLocationAbsolute

        public void syncLocationAbsolute(double posX,
                                 double posY,
                                 double posZ,
                                 float yaw,
                                 float pitch)
        Synchronizes the entity position / rotation absolutely
        Parameters:
        posX - - protocol position X
        posY - - protocol position Y
        posZ - - protocol position Z
        yaw - - protocol rotation yaw
        pitch - - protocol rotation pitch

      • syncLocation

        public void syncLocation(boolean position,
                         boolean rotation)
        Synchronizes the entity position / rotation relatively.
        Parameters:
        position - - whether to sync position
        rotation - - whether to sync rotation

      • syncLocation

        public void syncLocation(boolean position,
                         boolean rotation,
                         double posX,
                         double posY,
                         double posZ,
                         float yaw,
                         float pitch)
        Synchronizes the entity position / rotation relatively. If the relative change is too big, an absolute update is performed instead.
        Parameters:
        position - - whether to update position (read pos on/off)
        rotation - - whether to update rotation (read yawpitch on/off)
        posX - - protocol position X
        posY - - protocol position Y
        posZ - - protocol position Z
        yaw - - protocol rotation yaw
        pitch - - protocol rotation pitch

      • broadcast

        public void broadcast(CommonPacket packet)
        Sends a packet to all viewers, excluding the entity itself
        Parameters:
        packet - to send

      • broadcast

        public void broadcast(CommonPacket packet,
                      boolean self)
        Sends a packet to all viewers, and if set, to itself
        Parameters:
        packet - to send
        self - option: True to send to self (if a player), False to not send to self

      • getLocationPacket

        public CommonPacket getLocationPacket(double posX,
                                      double posY,
                                      double posZ,
                                      float yaw,
                                      float pitch)
        Gets a new packet with absolute Entity position information
        Parameters:
        posX - - position X (protocol)
        posY - - position Y (protocol)
        posZ - - position Z (protocol)
        yaw - - position yaw (protocol)
        pitch - - position pitch (protocol)
        Returns:
        a packet with absolute position information

      • getVelocityPacket

        public CommonPacket getVelocityPacket(double velX,
                                      double velY,
                                      double velZ)
        Gets a new packet with velocity information for this Entity
        Parameters:
        velX - - velocity X
        velY - - velocity Y
        velZ - - velocity Z
        Returns:
        a packet with velocity information

      • getSpawnPacket

        public CommonPacket getSpawnPacket()
        Creates a new spawn packet for spawning this Entity. To change the spawned entity type, override this method. By default, the entity is evaluated and the right packet is created automatically.
        Returns:
        spawn packet

      • getHeadRotationPacket

        public CommonPacket getHeadRotationPacket(float headRotation)
        Gets a new packet with head rotation information for this Entity
        Parameters:
        headRotation - value (protocol value)
        Returns:
        packet with head rotation information
